column5: Fished lac Seul 6/7 thru 6/12 at Black Bay Outpost out of Lac Seul Lodge. Water level was about three foot higher than normal and the fishing was great. Had two days that the six of us caught over 400 Walleye and a normal day was in the 250 range. Biggest Eye was 27 1/2" but caught a lot of 21" to 25" fish. Key was fishing the backs of bays that the wind had been pounding. Fish were in depths of 6' to 15' and jigs with minnows or crawlers performed equally. Water temps ranged from 51 to 60 with the warmer areas being the best producers. Mike Kansas
Thanks for the report, Mike. Headed to Black Bay this Friday for a week. Sending you a PM.
Thanks for the report, Mike. Will be at LSL in less than two weeks. I wish I had a big group of friends so we could get that Black Bay Outpost. That place looks great.
